text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with black pepper blackberry slush
that's right i'm going to show you
something called an intermezzo which is
a little thing we serve between courses
to cleanse the palate so this is not
really a dessert it could be I guess but
that's not what I'm using it for but
it's incredibly easy and here's how you
do it I had a half a pint of
blackberries so that's basically one cup
now I'm going to throw those in a
blender make sure you rinse them and
make sure you pick through for any
little stems or leaves or any other
inedible remnants so this recipe
basically just has two parts the fruit
and a simple CERP which is well that's
what it is a really simple syrup it's
sugar and water I'm going to put that on
medium heat and I'm just going to simply
cook it until the sugar melts and it
begins to simmer okay and that's it here
I'm going to give it a little stir which
really was completely unnecessary I just
really wanted to get the freakishly
small wooden spoon into another video
okay you guys really seem to like this
spoon a little too much but anyway once
the sugar is melted turn off the heat
and just let that cool down to room
temperature so I'm gonna dump in my
simple syrup and then believe it or not
a little black pepper how much a little
I did like three turns I'm fine here
with the pepper grinder okay so it's
just a pinch of black pepper and then
even smaller just a few grains of salt
just a tiny pinch I'm going to blend
that until it's liquefied and as you can
see there we have seeds to deal with we
do not want seeds in our blackberry
slush because those you know get stuck
between people's teeth and they get all
annoyed and they're like why did I come
to this jerks house for dinner now I got
seeds in my teeth so what we're going to
do is we're going to strain that through
a fine strainer and that's going to get
rid of all those seeds and you're going
to want to strain this into some kind of
shallow dish okay just a small little
two quart casserole dish is perfect and
I already know a lot of you're going to
ask can I use other berries for this
recipe
I think we both know the answer to that
of course you can all right so that
looks good everything's strained I'm
going to just give it the old shake of
sheikha to even it out I'm going to
cover it and I'm going to freeze it
until solid that's the recipe all right
if you can make ice you can make this
once it's frozen I'm going to take the
tines of a fork and I'm just going to
make a slush basically the sugar in the
berry and the CERP prevents this from
completely freezing it makes for very
very small ice crystals okay the more
sugar you have the less hard this
freezes that's just science
so once I've broken that up into a slush
like mixture I'm going to rewrap it
throw it back in the freezer until I'm
ready to serve and then once I'm ready
to go I'm going to serve this in small
little glasses this is not something you
give a big portion it is just a little
couple spoon bite you serve between
courses it has a sort of a bright
refreshing crisp flavor a little bit of
stringent just completely cleans your
palate and get you ready for the next
